intro: Haplopappus howellii, commonly known as Howell's pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and heat. Its small, yellow to orange flowers bloom in the spring, and the plant produces fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. Haplopappus howellii is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare species due to its limited distribution.
